channel.title: ATX Architects Podcast
channel.description: The ATX Architects Podcast focuses on architecture and design by focusing on architects and designers. The show features interviews and conversations with architects, designers, and artists of all kinds who call Austin, TX home. The show is hosted by E. Mickey Peavler, AIA, artist, architect, designer and raconteur.
channel.itunes:title: ATX Architects Podcast
channel.itunes:author: ATX Architects
channel.itunes:summary: The ATX Architects Podcast focuses on architecture, art and design by focusing on architects, artists and designers. The show features interviews and conversations with architects, designers, and artists of all kinds who call Austin, TX home. The show is hosted by E. Mickey Peavler, AIA, artist, architect, designer and raconteur.

item.title: Episode 40 - The Lovely Brigade
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Musicians Heidi and Kristen of the Lovely Brigade.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 39 - Adreon Henry
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Adreon Henry, artist, musician, graphic designer.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 38 - Rick Thomson
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Rick Thomson's journey to becoming a classic boat restorer is a fantastic story that you're going to love hearing. Rick started restoring boats in California during the wine growing off season. Now stationed in Texas he continues to restore boats for users and for shows. Check out some of his work at www.gotwoodboats.com
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, austin, texas, alyse black, singer song writer

item.title: Episode 37 - Liz Baloutine
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Liz Baloutine wants to save the world. Or perhaps the environment. Is there a difference really? She's an idealist. She loves plants and the beauty they bring into our lives. She believes starting vegetable gardens influences people to take more of an interest in planting in their homes and experimenting with fresh food. Seedlings Gardening is her contribution to local, sustainable, healthy food in Austin. www.seedlingsgardening.com
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, austin, texas, alyse black, singer song writer

item.title: Episode 36 - Alyse Black
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: After a childhood of musical theater and living abroad, Alyse began her career busking on the streets of Pike Place Market in Seattle. One rare sunny afternoon, the pianist for a local group wandered by, stood captivated for a moment, and then explained: he needed another singer for a show that night at a local club. There was no looking back. Alyse isn't busking any more. Between playing some of the best stages in cities across the US, she's completed three solo studio albums, received international awards for songwriting, and garnered impressive reviews for both her studio and live work.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, austin, texas, alyse black, singer song writer

item.title: Episode 35 - Jess Klein
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: A folk troubadour whose talents have been lauded on the national and international scene for almost a decade, Jess Klein writes songs that tell the story of the soul – from wrenching heartbreak to finding the strength to pick up and move on. Jess Klein emerged from the Boston music scene in 1998 with her independent release, Wishes Well Disguised, but it was her later releases – 2000’s Draw Them Near, 2005’s Strawberry Lover and 2006’s City Garden that would capture the attention of critics and fans worldwide.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, miranda rose, music, austin, adult contemporary

item.title: Episode 34 - Miranda Rose
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Miranda Rose is a rising star and Hot A/C singer/songwriter. Her powerful vocals incorporate country, rock and soul, drawing comparisons to other warm voiced superstars like Sheryl Crow, Kelly Clarkson, Carrie Underwood and Joss Stone. With personal, positive lyrics, her writing calls to mind a rtists such as Jewel, Taylor Swift, Shania Twain and Amy Lee. Sometimes soulful, sometimes sultry, always independent and unafraid to speak the truth; Miranda is a true pop country star shinning light on the best elements from today’s music and blending them into her own unique sound.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, miranda rose, music, austin, adult contemporary

item.title: Episode 33 - Heather Tolleson
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Austin artist Heather Tolleson, painter, sculpter, partner at Atelier 3D comes on the show today to talk about her work. Find out more about Heather at www.htolleson.com
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, heather tolleson, atelier 3d, art, sculpture, philosophy

item.title: Episode 32 - Jason Ludwig
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Musician Jason Ludwig talks with host Mickey Peavler on today's show. Jason has just realeased two new albums, Lost in Love and Tanglings, both of which run the stylistic range from orechestral epics to whispering ballads. He's playing all over Austin in January, so if you have a chance go see him play. Find out more at www.jasonludwig.com
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, jason ludwig, music, austin,

item.title: Episode 31 - Abby Goldsmith
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Abby Goldsmith is a computer animator, artist and illustrator. Her expertise is in animating for video games however she's started illustrating for books as well. Check some of her work at http://abbygoldsmith.com/
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, liz rathbone, ole miss, art, painting

item.title: Episode 30 - Liz Rathbone
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Elizabeth Rathbone, recent Austinite and college grad talks with host E. Mickey Peavler today about Austin, her work, school, and all that. Liz is one of the many fine artists Mickey met at the East Austin Studio Tour.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, liz rathbone, ole miss, art, painting

item.title: Episode 29 - Ryan Layden
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Ryan Layden is a unique artist in the folk genre touching many areas and styles. Drawing from many influences including Jeff Buckley. Ryan uses folk as a basis for his art while reaching into rock and many other areas to creat a totally new experience for the listener.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, ryan layden, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 28 - Bob Livingston
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Bob Livingston, singer-songwriter, bass player, and a founding member of The Lost Gonzo Band. Livingston was a key figure instigating the cosmic cowboy, progressive country and outlaw country music movements that distinguished the Austin, TX music scene in the 1970s. Over the years, Bob Livingston has gained a reputation as a band leader, solo artist, session musician and sideman in country music. He has toured without stop for 42 years, and is one of the most experienced and recorded musicians in all of Texas music. Livingston's newest CD, Gypsy Alibi, released by New Wilderness Records in 2011, won the "Album of the Year" at the Texas Music Awards 2011.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, Bob Livingston, lost gonzo band, texas album of the year

item.title: Episode 27 - Andrew Cherry
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Born and raised in Texas, Andrew Cherry has been drawing ever since he was a little kid. Nurturing his talent in illustration from his youth, he sought a fuller expression of his pictorial imagination with the art of filmmaking. Andrew found his artistic synergistic education at the Savannah College of Art and Design; Receiving a BFA in Film and Television on a painting scholarship. Since school he has taken on positions in the realm of television transferring him from coast to coast. However, in the summer of 2009 Andrew turned back to his first love of painting and illustration as his full pursuit. So whether it be painting or film, Andrew still lives out his pictorial imagination to it's fullest. Andrew currently lives in Austin, Texas where he is a freelance illustrator. Check out more of his work at www.andrewcherryart.com
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, andrew cherry, pump project, austin, art, texas, illustration, fine art, story board

item.title: Episode 26 - Steve Dubov
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: On today's show Austin artist Steve Dubov talks with host E. Mickey Peavler. Steve is Atelier 3-D partner and artist in residence, holds an MFA in Sculpture from Stanford University, and is Atelier 3-D’s primary instructor. Steve is an internationally collected sculptor and has instructed beginning through university-level students in Studio Art and Art History for over 40 years. View his mesmerizing sculptural work at www.foldedglass.com
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, steve dubov, atelier 3d, glass, sculpting, stanford, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 25 - Megan Jaster
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: On today's show Austin artist Megan Jaster with host E. Mickey Peavler. Orginally from Central Texas, surrounded by a farm and the inherent forces of nature, she was a contemplative observer. Thus began a life time of visual expression based on what was whispered, listening for the subtle yet powerful. She has exhibited exstensively in Austin Texas. On the international front, she was a part of a touring exhibition of Neo Symbolist through Eastern Europe. Her style is an evolution of traditional and digital techniques. This provides a rich palette of options for images that incarnate depending on what is to be explored.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, megan jaster, art garage austin, acrylic, artist, resin, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 24 - Betty Soo
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: On today's show singer and song writer Betty Soo talks with host E. Mickey Peavler. Her first studio efforts (Let Me Love You, 2005; Little Tiny Secrets, 2007, Never the Pretty Girl EP, 2007) were well received by critics, earning praise locally and nationally - even securing her performance opportunities overseas. And she’s not slowing down any time soon. Since their release, she has earned multiple songwriting awards (including Kerrville New Folk, Wildflower Festival, and Big Top Chautauqua Songwriter of the Year) and has proven herself a strong, engaging, often hilarious live performer.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, betty soo, singer, song writer,austin, texas

item.title: Episode 23 - Ron Gross
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Ron Gross started his career in communications over 25 years ago as a writer and photographer for the publica relations department of a New York based community college. He attended Pratt institute of Design and then went on to get a degree in advertising design at the Academy of Art University in San Fransisco. He has worked at marketing agencies in Seatyle, Connecticut, New york and San Fransisco.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, Ron Gross, marketing, creative consultant, advertising, branding, seattle, san fransisco, new yorkaustin, texas

item.title: Episode 22 - Loves It!
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Loves It! formed when two best friends, Vaughn Walters and Jenny Parrott, dreamed of traveling the world together singing songs! Both accomplished solo writers, they were surprised and excited to see their collaborative works sparkle! Besides inventive songwriting that travels between folk, country, indie pop and swing, each is a multi-instrumentalist and the live show features claw hammer banjo, ...guitars, mandolin, fiddle, and heart felt inspired singing. Vaughn hails from West by God Virginia and brings his love of country, punk rock, and folk to the duo's sound. Jenny Parrott is from New Haven CT and brings a love of soul, swing and gospel. With songs and musical ideas formed by their experiences traveling with other musicians (Shotgun Party, Leo Rondeau), these veterans of the road have come together to create a unique sound that is fun, modern and you will totes LOVES IT!
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, music, indie pop, Loves It, Jenny Parrott, Vaugn Walters, Shotgun Party, Eaglize It, Continental Club, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 21 - Karen Maness
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: In 1999 Karen Maness accepted her current position as Charge Scenic Artist at Texas Performing Arts at the University of Texas at Austin. There she also teaches scenic art and figurative painting for the Department of Theatre and Dance. Her further training includes painting and drawing classes at The Florence Academy of Art, Florence, Italy and Cobalt Studios, White Lake, New York. She teaches master painting classes in the United States and abroad, most recently for the School of Theater at California Institute of the Arts in Valencia, CA., and at the Costa Rican Center of Science and Culture in San Jose, Costa Rica. She is serving in her fifth year as the Co-Commissioner of Scene Design, for the United States Institute for Theatre Technology. Find out more about Karen and her work at www.karenmaness.com
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, theater, art, painting, oil, acrylic, karen maness, scene painting, portrait, landscape, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 20 - Vanessa Lively
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Vanessa Lively, musician, artist and graphic designer is our guest on today's show. For a woman who thrives on jumping into the unknown with both feet, Vanessa Lively took an unusual approach to her new album, Uncovering Stones. She and her producer-husband, Jason, planned nearly every note before recording it – which they did in their Austin home, with co-producer/engineer Keith Gary. The result is a compelling mix of tempos and styles filled with hints of urban, world, L atin, funk and pop that fully captures her compassionate nature and love of community. Uncovering Stones is, in fact, all about connecting. Vanessa even painted the album art beforehand – on 42 canvas squares she sold individually to fund the 12-song disc. Lively describes its themes as “feeling other people’s struggles and joys and being connected with them.” After raking blueberries in Maine as a migrant farm worker and living in South America with her husband to do volunteer work in impoverished areas, she feels those connections deeply – and when you listen, you will, too. Find out more and buy some music at www.vanessalively.com
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, music, painting, graphic design, Vanessy Lively, Uncovering Stones, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 19 - Clark Richardson Architects
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Architects April Clark and Ed Richardson talk with host E. Mickey peavler today. Creatively collaborating since 2001, April Clark and Ed Richardson formed the architecture firm Clark Richardson Architects in 2009 with the goal of creating contemporary experiences through form, sustainability and detail. Clark Richardson Architects specializes in sustainable residential and commercial design. Find out more about them and thier work at www.clarkrichardson.com
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, architecture, clark richardson architects, april clark, ed richardson, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 18 - Larry Jolly
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Austin graphic designer and artist Larry Jolly talks with host E. Mickey Peavler today. Larry talks about working in graphic design and branding and returning to painting after almost 25 years away. Learn more about Larry or contact him through www.jollydesign.com
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, art, acrylic, painting, art garage austin, grant reid, www.grantsreid.com, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 17 - Grant Reid
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Austin artist and photographer Grant Reid is E. Mickey Peavler's host today. Grant talks growing up in Glasgow, fashion and photography, art and Austin. Find out more about Grant and his work at www.grantsreid.com
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, art, acrylic, painting, art garage austin, grant reid, www.grantsreid.com, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 16 - Burl Norville
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Austin artist Burl Norville is E. Mickey Peavler's guest on today's show. Burl is not only a fantastic painter, working in a tradition of pop art, but a musician and song writer. Burl lost his hearing in 2002 at the age of 30 and is now, what is considered, profoundly deaf. Burl tells the story of losing his hearing and talks about his paintings and his painting process.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, art, acrylic, painting, austin-artists, burl norville, deaf, hearing impared, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 15 - Roy and Maria Gatling
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Roy and Maria Gatling are among Austin's premier artistic entrepreneurs. Roy is a film maker and photographer, and Maria is a painter. They own and operate an Austin online magazine which provides insight into local artisans found at: www.austin-artists.com. It is a place where visual artists, culinary artists, musicians and other performing artists tell their story. Maria is also the author of the book "Be Inspired: Create Something Everyday"; which provides activities and tips for living a creative lifestyle. Find out more about the Gatlings and their work at www.austin-artists.com and www.mariagatling.com.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, art, acrylic, painting, austin-artists, roy gatling, maria gatling, mary gatling, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 14 - Dawn Winter
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Dawn Winter talks with host E. Mickey Peavler on today's show. Dawn has been painting for just over 6 years and has already exhibited her work around Austin, and currently shows at Art Garage Austin. Dawn tells Mickey about her process, how she approaches each painting both conceptually and technically and what she's thinking when she starts each painting. See more of Dawn's work at www.dawnwinter.net.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, art, acrylic, painting, art garage, dawn winter, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 13 - Mitchell and Harris
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Anna Mae Mitchell and G. Pat Harris talk with E. Mickey Peavler about their music, their musical careers and thier new album. Anna Mae Mitchell G. Pat Harris first performed together throughout Michigan in a traditional bluegrass band for years before relocating to different parts of the country. In July 2009, they started performing again and collaborating on material that branches out from traditional bluegrass into a broad Americana sound which includes elements of folk, rock, and jazz, and has a range of lyrical content with influences from Goethe to Bob Dylan. In this new venture, they are performing original music in independently produced intimate shows across the country. Find more information about Mitchell and Harris at their website: www.mitchellandharris.com.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, music, bluegrass, Mitchell and Harris, austin, texas

item.title: Episode 12 - Archimedes Media Lab
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Johnny and Sarah from Archimedes Media Lab talk with E. Mickey Peavler about their film making philosophy, process and technique. Archimedes Media Lab is a full service HD Video Production and Special Effects Studio, specializing in the Weird and Fantastic. For more information visit their website at www.archimedesmedialab.com
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, AIA, film, production, muppet, puppet, Austin, cinema, poe, cgi, creature suit

item.title: Episode 11 - Clovis Heimsath, FAIA
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Architect Clovis Heimsath, FAIA talks with host E. Mickey Peavler, AIA about his more than 50 years in architecture, growing up as a preacher's son and the difficulties in getting 20 year olds to focus. Clovis founded Clovis Heimsath Architects, now Heimsath Architects, in 1959, and is the author of several books on architetural design, theory and history. Find out more about Clovis at www.heimsath.com or www.studiohai.com.
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, Heimsath, architects, art, Clovis Heimsath, AIA, FAIA, Yale, architecture, Fulbright, Aalto

item.title: Episode 10 - Kelly Wendt
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Photographer and web-designer Kelly Wendt talks with host E. Mickey Peavler on this episode. Kelly does a wide range of work from weddings and head shots to band portraits and product shoots. Find out more about Kelly at her website at www.kellywendt.com
item.itunes:keywords: ATX Architects, Peavler, Wendt, architecture, design, art, photography, web design

item.title: Episode 9 - Naomi Brown-Smith
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Costume designer and interior designer Naomi Brown-Smith talks with host E. Mickey Peavler today. Naomi has worked on projects ranging from sci-fi adventures to european teen star vehicles and tells some fun and fantastic stories about her experiences.
item.itunes:keywords: architecture, design, film, sci-fi, costume, clothes, interior design

item.title: Episode 8 - Chadwick and Spector
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: New York City artists, Chadwick Gray and Laura Spector, currently reside in Austin, TX. They are both recipients of the prestigious New York Foundation for the Arts Fellowship Award (2001), and they have been included as finalists for the Sovereign Asian Art Award in both 2006 and 2008 where their work auctioned at Sotheby's Hong Kong. Their work has been published in The Harvard Review, Ripley's Believe It Or Not! and in the book, The Real Real Thing: The Model in the Mirror of Art, by Wendy Steiner. Their work can be seen in exhibitions and collections around the world, and at their website at www.chadwickandspector.com
item.itunes:keywords: architecture, design, art, museum, museum anatomy

item.title: Episode 7 - Aaron Smith
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: On today's episode film and commercial producer, director and sometimes craft service provider talks with host E. Mickey Peavler. They discuss Aaron's thoughts about the community it takes to make for happy film makers and therefore good film, the sometimes hard decisions those in creative professions have to make when dealing with the suits, and perhaps most importantly, what a producer actually does. Links to some of the films, commercials and reels they spoke about follow. For additional links visit the ATX Architects facebook page. http://vimeo.com/7707093, http://vimeo.com/27593627
item.itunes:keywords: architecture,design, music, composer, soundtrack

item.title: Episode 6 - Cody Cook
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: On this episode musician, composer and soundtrack author talks with host E. Mickey Peavler. They discuss Cody's musical experiences and influences, his techniques and methodology and what he sees the path to hollywood composing might be.
item.itunes:keywords: architecture,design, music, composer, soundtrack

item.title: Episode 5 - Will "The Mangler" Rodriguez
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Cartoonist and Comic Book artist Will "The Mangler" Rodriguez, author of the web based comic strip Mangled Stare, sits down with host E. Mickey Peavler for a fantastic talk about cartoons, comics and conventions. The Mangler talks about his influences and his origin story.
item.itunes:keywords: architecture,design,cartoons, comics

item.title: Episode 4 - Joel Bewley
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: In Episode 3 host Mickey Peavler sits down with industrial designer Joel Bewley of Bewley Design Lab. Joel's primary interest is automotive design, specifically a small car with network ownership and rental potential, similar to the car2go, but specifically designed for networking. To see more of Joel's work visit his website at http://www.bdlworks.com
item.itunes:keywords: architecture,design,industrial design

item.title: Episode 3 - Chris Celusniak
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Artist Chris Celusiak and host Mickey Peavler talk about graphic design, fine arts and Chris' work. Chris has been working in fine arts and graphic design for over 30 years. http://www.chriscelusniak.com

item.title: Episode 2 - Tom Lusardi
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Graphic artist Tom Lusardi of Trifecta Interactive sits down with host Mickey Peavler to talk about graphic design, and the business of branding and identity. We get into current trends in web design, what qualifies as good and bad design, Tom's training, and his process when working on a project.

item.title: Episode 1 - ATX Architects Podcast
item.itunes:author: ATX Architects
item.dc:creator: ATX Architects
item.description: Welcome to the ATX Architects podcast. On the show we'll be interviewing architects, designers, artists, any and all creative types who call Austin, TX home.
